title: How to Make Beetroot Dip

steps.headline: Wash beetroot.
steps.description: Leave the skin intact; use a vegetable brush to remove stubborn stains. Trim off stems to about 3cm/1.5" in length.

steps.headline: Place the beetroot in a heavy-based saucepan filled with salted water.
Allow the beetroot to simmer over low heat for three quarters of an hour, or until tender.
Drain beetroot and allow to cool slightly.
Peel beetroot.
steps.description: When the beetroot is cool enough to handle, use a peeler to assist removal of the beetroot skin. After cooking, it should come off easily.

steps.headline: Chop the peeled beetroot into chunks.
Blend the beetroot until smooth.
steps.description: Put the beetroot purée into a serving bowl.

steps.headline: Fry the cumin seeds in a dry, heated pan.
steps.description: Brown slowly over low heat until the fragrance is released. Keep stirring - do not allow seeds to burn or you will need to start again. Allow the seeds to cool and then grind in a mortar and pestle.

steps.headline: Mix crushed cumin into the puréed beetroot.
steps.description: Add ginger, sugar and salt to taste. Mix together well.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the bowl out with a selection of suitable dipping breads and any other dips. Alternatively, serve the beetroot in carved out veggies, as shown in the photo accompanying this article.

text: Wash beetroot. Leave the skin intact; use a vegetable brush to remove stubborn stains. Trim off stems to about 3cm/1.5" in length. Place the beetroot in a heavy-based saucepan filled with salted water.  Allow the beetroot to simmer over low heat for three quarters of an hour, or until tender.  Drain beetroot and allow to cool slightly.  Peel beetroot. When the beetroot is cool enough to handle, use a peeler to assist removal of the beetroot skin. After cooking, it should come off easily. Chop the peeled beetroot into chunks.  Blend the beetroot until smooth. Put the beetroot purée into a serving bowl. Fry the cumin seeds in a dry, heated pan. Brown slowly over low heat until the fragrance is released. Keep stirring - do not allow seeds to burn or you will need to start again. Allow the seeds to cool and then grind in a mortar and pestle. Mix crushed cumin into the puréed beetroot. Add ginger, sugar and salt to taste. Mix together well. Serve. Place the bowl out with a selection of suitable dipping breads and any other dips. Alternatively, serve the beetroot in carved out veggies, as shown in the photo accompanying this article.
